description:
Parked on both sides of Pacific Street, mainly the block between Texas and Alabama intersections, are at least 3 vehicles from homeless individuals and 1 potentially abandoned compact-suv. 

1 ) A lone female who sleeps in a dark blue Chrysler T&C minivan moves her van from up and down this entire street to either side of the street in order to avoid detection. She did this for a year since late Spring or early Summer 2023, then finally left for 1 month in July, and returned to this area about 2 weeks now. When she feels that someone notices, she parks further south on the next block of Pacific Street just right after Texas Street (on either side to try and blend in). Sometimes she sleeps in her car for 1-3 days high on drugs. When she does wake up, she'll walk to FitEvo gym to shower or to Lowe's to use the restroom and try to blend into the neighborhood, but she does not and has never lived anywhere in the Roosevelt neighborhood, yet she likes to park on this Street because of wide busier roads and many empty parking spaces. The mini van has a big dent on the rear bumper (driver's side). When parked, there is always a silver-reflective accordian sunvisor on the dash, and sometimes it isn't put up good because she monitors from the backseat where she has a mattress. If you past by her van, you can sometimes smell the smoked meth coming out from her vehicle (a sweet smell). 

2.) An older light brown compact-SUV Honda has been sitting on Pacific Street (in front of 2412 Pacific St) without being moved for almost 2 months now. No person has been seen entering the vehicle since June. 

3.) A large white full-size SUV (GMC Yukon) recently started parking on Pacific Street the last 1.5 to 2 weeks and has never moved from that spot since. It sits parked north-bound on Pacific St on the side of the apartments that are facing south towards Texas St, OR between 2412 and 2400 Pacific Street houses. Potentially owned by homeless individual. 

4 ) A black cadillac CTS (4-door sedan car) from early 2000s has been parked in front on Pacific St in fronf of 2412 Pacific St for the last 4 days. Potentially another druggie (the lady in the mini-dark blue chrysler van).
address: 2400-2498 Pacific St Bellingham, WA, 98229, USA

description:
Office of the Mayor,
I live at 291 Morse St and have been reporting an issue with my sidewalk since Feb 2011. I think Scott Jackson was the mayor and it was before ClickFix, from which I have emails to and from his office. The sidewalk and driveway apron is very cracked, broken, crumbling and many people have tripped on it. I've been reporting on ClickFix and the responses are they're working on 2007 & 2008 complaints or funding. It has been marked out many times that you can't see the markings any longer.

On 8/28/24 I was sitting on my porch and a man was pushing a lady in a wheelchair and they got stuck. Many people walk and jog on this street and some are elderly. When it rains you either have to walk on my grass or the grass between the sidewalk and street.

This is an issue that needs to be taken care of immediately, not another 13 years. It wouldn't only be my property, my next door neighbor's sidewalk 287 Morse is also in need of repair. The sidewalks have not been repaired/replaced in over 50 years.

Issue# 3936684 12/7/2017,
         Issue# 9668886  4/7/2021 (engineering inspector pics)
